availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James S. Hand (Pendleton County, KY, farmer and justice of the peace)

body.p: Pendleton County, Kentucky, farmer and justice of the peace. Kentucky native. Farmer in Pendleton County, Kentucky, in 1850. Household owned four enslaved persons in Pendleton County in 1850. Farmer in Pendleton County in 1860. Owned one enslaved person in Pendleton County in 1860. Household owned an additional eight enslaved persons in Pendleton County in 1860. Justice of the peace in Pendleton County in 1862.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Pendleton County, District 2, p. 326A.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Pendleton County, District 2, p. 456.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Pendleton County, p. 572.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Pendleton County, p. 189B.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Pendleton County, Precinct 7, p. 512B.
